data:
# Next Steps & Checklist ## Introduction Congratulations on completing the Excel High School Student Orientation! You're now equipped with essential information to begin your academic journey successfully. This final section addresses common questions and provides a clear checklist of immediate steps to take. Addressing these practical concerns now will help you start your coursework with confidence and maintain momentum in your educational path. ## Frequently Asked Questions ### Tuition and Payments
When and how do I make tuition payments?

Excel High School offers several payment options to fit your needs:

  • Full payment (includes a discount)
  • Semester payment plans
  • Monthly payment plans

All payments can be managed through your student portal under the "Billing" section. If you have questions about your payment plan or need to adjust your schedule, contact our Finance Department at (888) 317-3377.

Can I get a refund if I change my mind?

Excel High School offers a 5-day cancellation policy from the date of enrollment. If you decide to withdraw within this period, you may be eligible for a refund minus any applicable fees. After this period, refund eligibility follows our published refund policy.

What if I'm having trouble making a payment?

We understand that financial circumstances can change. If you're experiencing difficulty:

  • Contact our Finance Department as soon as possible
  • Explore alternative payment plan options
  • Discuss potential extensions (must be arranged before due dates)

Early communication is key to resolving payment issues successfully.

### Textbooks and Materials
Do I need to purchase textbooks?

No, Excel High School's program is designed to be completely online with all necessary learning materials included in your courses. There are no additional textbooks to purchase.

What supplies do I need for my courses?

You'll need:

  • Reliable internet access
  • A computer or tablet
  • Basic school supplies for note-taking

Some courses may require specific software or tools, which will be clearly communicated in the course introduction.

How do I access my course materials?

All course materials are available through your student portal:

  • Log in to your student account
  • Navigate to "My Courses"
  • Select the specific course to view all available materials
  • Many materials can be downloaded as PDFs for offline study

If you have trouble accessing any materials, contact technical support immediately.

### Academic Concerns
What happens if I don't pass a course?

If you don't pass a course:

  • You'll need to retake the course to earn credit
  • A course retake fee may apply
  • Your academic advisor will help you develop a plan to succeed in your second attempt
  • Courses you didn't pass remain on your transcript but are replaced with the new grade upon successful completion

The most important step is to communicate with your academic advisor at the first sign of difficulty.

How long do I have to complete each course?

Standard courses should be completed within 12 weeks, though extensions may be available if needed. Self-paced options allow for flexibility, but maintaining a consistent schedule is strongly recommended for academic success.

How can I get help if I'm struggling with coursework?

Excel High School offers multiple support options:

  • Direct teacher communication through the messaging system
  • Virtual tutoring sessions (schedule through your student portal)
  • Academic advisors who can help with study strategies
  • Office hours with your instructors

Don't wait until you're falling behind to seek help. Reaching out to your instructors early is strongly encouraged.

## Your Next Steps Checklist Complete these important tasks to ensure a smooth start to your academic journey: - [ ] **Log in to your student portal** and explore the dashboard - [ ] **Review your academic plan** and confirm your course schedule - [ ] **Set up your payment schedule** (if not already done) - [ ] **Create a weekly study schedule** that fits your personal commitments - [ ] **Set up a dedicated study space** with necessary supplies and technology - [ ] **Bookmark the academic support resources** page for quick reference - [ ] **Connect with your academic advisor** to introduce yourself - [ ] **Download and review the Student Handbook** for future reference - [ ] **Set calendar reminders** for important academic dates and deadlines - [ ] **Begin your first course** by clicking on the course title in your dashboard ## Final Thoughts Completing this orientation is your first achievement at Excel High School! Successful online learning requires self-discipline, time management, and regular communication. Don't hesitate to reach out whenever you have questions or concerns—our entire team is committed to your success. We recommend checking in with your academic advisor at least once per month to ensure you're progressing as planned. By following the checklist above and keeping the FAQ information handy, you'll be well-positioned to navigate your academic program successfully. Congratulations again on taking this important step toward your educational goals. We look forward to celebrating your future achievements as a student at Excel High School! • Simplified language in several places to improve readability for high school students (e.g., changed "familiarize yourself" to "explore," replaced "proactive communication" with "reaching out early") • Changed "if you fail a course" to "if you don't pass a course" to use more supportive, less discouraging language • Removed some redundant phrases to make the content more concise and easier to follow • Maintained all essential information while making the tone more approachable for teenage learners in an asynchronous environment • Removed self-referential language (like "this final section") to create a more direct connection with the student reader
